resources.string: This launcher, currently in alpha, is developed by Daniel Puckowski. Launcher4 is intended to be a lightweight homescreen-replacement application. If you have questions about the project or wish to contribute, email puckowski.d@gmail.com. For more information please visit: https://sites.google.com/site/androidlauncherproject/about
If you have any questions or comments about Launcher4 feel free to share them here. When you are done typing your message you may select your Email client of choice to send it.

If you are experiencing an issue with Launcher4 (such as application crashes, an unexpected behavior, or visual glitches) then you may describe the problem you are having here. When you are done typing your message you may select your Email client of choice to send it.
By default recent apps list is shown. Running apps list requires Android version 3.0 or greater (Android Honeycomb).
Long press of back button will show list of all homescreens. Disabled for the first homescreen. List of homescreens may also be accessed via long press of the All Apps button."
Set target resolution for loading an image into memory. Default resolution is 720p. Some devices may not be able to support higher resolutions.
Set bitmap configuration type. Using a configuration that stores pixels using fewer bytes will reduce memory consumption when setting wallpaper. The default is RGB_565.
May speed up wallpaper load times. However, disabling this may lead to crashes (out of memory errors).
Disable drawing of homescreens with cache. This also affects homescreen animations. Depending on the device, this may impact perceived UI performance.
Set the quality of the drawing cache for homescreens and homescreen animations.
Launcher will periodically collect VM heap size data for debugging/testing purposes.
Set the interval to collect heap data. Shorter intervals may impact device performance/responsiveness. Intended for debugging purposes only. Default is 5 seconds.
Set the numbers of samples to collect. Newer samples will replace the oldest samples stored if capacity is reached. Default is 24.
Homescreens will change orientation according to device orientation. This setting is still under development and is intended for testing purposes only.
